requests.name: 4 wheeled Mobility Scooter
requests.description:
Client is a 51yo man who has Parkinson's Disease and recently suffered a stroke. As a result of his medical illnesses, wife is currently the solebreadwinner for the family of 7 (3 children and 2 elderly parents). 
In a bid to alleviate some of wife's burden, client is currently looking for jobs and if successful, would require a 4-wheel mobility scooter to travel to work.

requests.name: Motorised Scooter
requests.description:
Client is a cancer patient and staying alone. Client has some mobility issues. Thus, having a motorised scooter will allow client to go about his daily activities.

Note: Client can only use a motorised scooter that is able to support 100-150kg   in weight.

requests.name: electric wheelchair
requests.description:
client is requesting for an electric wheelchair due to mobility issues.
 

He recently developed a condition where all his bones are fusing together starting with his legs, and requires a wheelchair to get around. As he is losing mobility in his hands as well, an electric wheelchair would be more appropriate.

requests.name: Motorized Wheelchair Needed for Elderly Client!
requests.description: Client is an elderly woman with limited mobility. She is presently residing alone and is dependent on others when she utilizes her manual wheelchair. The motorized wheelchair will help her to regain her personal independence and enable her to fulfil her day-to-day needs and errands with more ease.

requests.name: Mobility Scooter
requests.description:
Client, 49F, works as a Grabfood deliverer. She is a divorcee and has two children living with her, aged 20M and 16F. She has been using a second-hand mobility scooter with faulty brakes, which has posed as a physical safety concern for her. She suffers from eroded knee joint cartilage on both knees which had been impacted from having to use her legs to control the speed when slowing down. She is also diagnosed with asthma/chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and is on regular inhalers. She gets short of breath when she walks long distances and hence, is heavily reliant on her mobility scooter. 

Client is looking for a replacement mobility scooter that has working brakes. She is open to having a second-hand one as well.

contact.org: Care Corner Family Service Centre - Toa Payoh
contact.name: Merissa Boh

requests.name: Motorize wheelchair
requests.description: Client is an elderly man with diabetes. Due to water retention he is not able to walk very well. If you are keen to help them out, please contact Shane Lim from Whampoa FSC @ 83887716

requests.name: Food Rations
requests.description:
The family is in need of the following food items and all the food must be Halal certified the family observes the halal dietary requirements.                                         
                                                              Dry Food:Rice: Golden Eagle (Thai Rice) or other brand @ 1x10kg;1 tray x30 eggs;1 tin x Milo powder;1 tin x Nescafe Coffee Powder;4 tins x 395g Ayam Brand Canned Sardines; 1 bottle x Swee Soya Bean Sauce (Habhal's Kicap Manis); 1 packet x Maggi Mee (Curry); 1 bottle x Nutella Spread. Fresh:	any amount Fruits (banana, red apple, rockmelon, watermelon, mango), Vegetables (Brocolli, round spinach, carrots), 1 packet x white bread. Wet/frozen:1 packet x Chicken nuggets; 1 packet x Popcorn chicken; 2 packet x Fishball; 2 whole fresh chicken pieces; 2 packets x Frozen fish fillet.                                 
                                                              The food items will be delivered to beneficiary's home and please contact us for delivery details. Email: dik@childrensociety.org.sg. Contact No.: 9436 7401.

*Note: Delivery costs will be covered by donors. We appreciate your kind donation and generosity. Every makes a difference!

requests.name: Volunteer Driver
requests.description: This is a family of 3, consisting of a single mother with 2 young children, 1 of whom has Autism. Mother is unable to get daughter (with special needs) adjusted to school bus transport onboarding time in the morning due to daughter’s self injurious behaviours. Mother is unable to afford sending daughter to school via taxi due to financial difficulties. As such, she is requesting for help if there are any volunteer drivers to send her daughter to school in the morning, while the school works on various strategies to manage daughter’s behavioural issues. Mother is flexible with timing as long as it is after 7.30pm.

requests.description: Client is a single-parent of 5 children (3 older teens who are schooling and 2 younger children aged 2 & 4). Besides supporting her children, client also needs to support her elderly parents. She recently faced a dip in her income due to lesser working hours, and is struggling to support her younger children's diapers needs. She thus hopes to receive support for milk to tide her over the next 2 months while waiting for her job to stabilise.

contact.org: AMKFSC Community Services Ltd - Cheng San
contact.name: Lynn Yeo

requests.name: Milk & Diapers
requests.description: Clt's husband suffered lost of income due to covid. They would appreciate receiving support for milk and diapers so that they can clear their outstanding bills. Diapers- Huggies - Nature made (L size) Enfamil A+ stage 2

contact.org: Fei Yue Family Service Centre @ Bukit Batok
contact.name: Kee Ru Wei

requests.name: Drypers Drypantz XXL
requests.description: Family of 6, including parents and children aged 8, 6, 4 and 3. Father was recently remanded and mother is holding a job which was greatly affected by COVID-19 since 2020. Family solely depends on mother's income and struggles to support younger children basic needs such as diapers and milk, and daily needs such as detergent.

requests.name: Diapers & Milk powder
requests.description: Client looking for a kind-hearted donor to support the family with diapers and milk powder. Due to the strained marital relationship, the mother single-handedly taking care of her 7 children ages range from infant to 14 yrs old in an HDB rental unit. Mother quit employment after delivery of her 7th child late last year as she is the primary caregiver and her existing medical condition. Essential items needed are Diapers M size and XXL size and milk powder Nan Optipro2 (stage 2) and Abbot Grow Preschool (stage 4)for her young ones. Do not hesitate to contact me at 94348233 should you be able to help. Thanks much!

contact.org: Hougang Sheng Hong Family Service Centre
contact.name: Dennis Ng

requests.name: Merrie Diapers (size XL)
requests.description: Low-income family of 2 young children, 8 mths and 2 years old, require milk powder for the younger child. Wife is the sole breadwinner and spouse is unemployed due to LTVP. Any quantity is appreciated! The family is experiencing financial constraints due to the high expenses for the milk powders and diapers.

requests.name: Milk powder: Aptamil Stage 4 (3 tins)
requests.description: Low-income family of 2 young children, 8 mths and 2 years old, require milk powder for the younger child. Wife is the sole breadwinner and spouse is unemployed due to LTVP. The family is experiencing financial constraints due to the high expenses for the milk powders and diapers.

requests.name: Nature One Dairy Premium Milk Drink Formula - Step 3 (2 tins)
requests.description: Family of 5 with 3 young children. Parents are both working to provide for the children but with low income. Parents are looking for this specific milk formula.

requests.name: S26 Milk Powder Stage 3
requests.description:
Client is in her 60s and caregiver to her 80+ year old mother and 3 grandchildren (5,2,1). The children's parents are not involved in the care of the grandparents and reside at a different address. Thus, client who is unemployed struggles financially to bring up the children.

Client receives milk powder rations for 1 year old toddler but milk powder is not suitable for him and causes him to have diarrhoea. Thus, client hopes to get the suitable milk powder (S26 brand Stage 3) for her youngest grandchild.

contact.org: NTUC Health Cluster Support - Taman Jurong
contact.name: Xavierlyn Tan

requests.name: Dumex Mamil Gold Step 4
requests.description: Please contact Social Worker Jimmy at jimmygoh@thkmc.org.sg or 8718 8444 to liaise. Family lives in public rental housing with another 3 children in secondary school and 1 in primary school.

requests.name: Milk Powder & Diapers
requests.description: Client is the sole-breadwinner of his family. Together with his Vietnamese wife and his 2 young children, aged 23 months (coming to 2 years old) and 8 months-old baby, the family lives in a one-room rental flat in Marine Terrace. Client is hoping for some donations of milk supplies and diapers to lighten his financial burden. Due to his unstable income since the start of Covid-19 pandemic, family has been struggling financially. Client hopes to request for: 1) a few tins of Nestle NAN Optipro H.A. Growing Up Milk Stage 3 2) a few tins of Nestle Nan Optipro Infant Milk Formula Stage 2 3) a few packets of Merries XXL Walker Pants 4) a few packets of Pampers L Tape. requests.name: CPAP Machine with Humidifier
requests.description:
On behalf of 1 one of our staff, who has been with us for more than 5 years. He is diagnosed with obstructive sleep apnea. 

He is required to sleep with the monitoring of a respironics dreamstation with humidifier every night. For the last few months, he has been renting the machine weekly, but the cost is quite high for him.
He cannot afford to purchase a set of the respoionics dreamstation with humidifier for regulating his breathing while sleeping.

Hence, we are requesting to support him a CPAP Machine with Humidifier.

We run a home providing drug rehabilitation and after-care services to male drug addicts and ex-offenders in Singapore. This is a residential programme carried out in our agency home, which was graciously provided by the Singapore government in recognition of our services to the community. WE have total about 80 to 90 in house stay of residents and staffs. The Helping Hand is a Volunteer Welfare Organization affiliated with the National Council of Social Service.

requests.name: Adult Diaper (Brand: Tena) Size XS/S
requests.description: 11 year-old child with cerebral palsy requires adult diapers, as she is wheelchair bound and requires assistance with her daily cares. Family of 6 has only 1 breadwinner who earns a low income, struggling to make ends meet. Diaper is needed to maintain basic hygiene.

contact.org: Fei Yue Family Service Centre @ Bukit Batok
contact.name: Victoria Chong

requests.name: Adult Absorbent Protector
requests.description: Elderly man with bladder control issues requires urine absorbent pads while he recovers from a recent accident.

requests.name: QuickVue At-Home OTC COVID-19 Test (25 Tests/Kit)
requests.description:
In line with the present COVID-19 situation, our organisation, The Helping Hand has added layer of ringfencing to help to identify cases and prevent further transmission, we have started conducting mandatory Covid-19 testing to all residents and staff since 15th July 2021.
The Helping Hand is a Voluntary Welfare Organization affiliated with the National Council of Social Service. We run a home providing drug rehabilitation and after-care services to male drug addicts and ex-offenders in Singapore. This is a residential programme carried out in our agency home, which was graciously provided by the Singapore government in recognition of our services to the community. 
We have a total of about 100 residents and staff staying in at our premise. We are using the QuickVue At-Home OTC COVID-19 Test (25 Tests/Kit).

Here is the link for the requested item, thank you for your kindness.

https://www.guardian.com.sg/quickvue-at-home-otc-covid-19-test-25-tests-kit/p/619909

requests.name: Bicycle
requests.description:
Requesting for a donated bicycle for client. Client is a pregnant mother who is caregiving for a young son. 

Client used to send Son to Childcare on foot (45 mins walk) but walking to Childcare has became tiring for client since her pregnancy. Furthermore, client has a weakened cervix due to previous miscarriages. An alternative route would be to take two buses and walk 10 minutes, thus client would prefer to cycle to Childcare if possible. 

Family is currently reliant on SSO financial assistance and is not able to afford a bicycle or the cost of bicycle-sharing daily.

offers.name: Single Bedframe and pull out bed with 2 spring mattresses
offers.description:
Single Bedframe and pull out bed with 2 spring mattresses

Description: Single bedframe with pull out bed. Pull out bed can be combined to make a double bed. 

Bedframe condition: Stable and sturdy. No sounds. Headboard has bit wear and tear. Pull out bedframe has some rusted parts at the underside but do not affect functionality.

Mattress condition: Spring mattress, no sunken areas and minimal stains. 

Age of item: 8 years

Dimensions:  2.14m x 0.92m x 0.57 m (H) (with mattress). Height of headboard: 1.08m

Requests: 
1) Deliver to be on Monday (5-8pm) or Sunday afternoons by mid August. Please note the age of item and availability of client before reserving. 
2) Please briefly share circumstances of the famlly so that donor can understand whom they are helping.
